googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* Nevada will send every registered voter a mail-in ballot for the November 3, 2020 election.
* You can still a request a one-time absentee ballot if you will be away from home during a specific election.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You can register to vote online if you have a Nevada driver's license or state ID card. If not, you can still register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Nevada driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Nevada you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * have attained the age of 18 years on the date of the next election
  * have continuously resided in the State of Nevada, in your county, at least 30 days and in your precinct at least 10 days before the next election
  * have your civil rights restored if you were convicted of a felony
  * not be determined by a court of law to be mentally incompetent
  * claim no other place as your legal residence
